availability.p: All research and writing of Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition annotations was undertaken by project staff, volunteers, and interns. Each record contains citations to relevant primary and secondary source material. All annotations are copyright Kentucky Historical Society, and should be referenced as such in any published work.

seriesStmt.title: Civil War Governors of Kentucky Digital Documentary Edition

person.persName: William S. D. Megowan (Louisville, Kentucky, clerk, sheriff, and major (U.S.A))

body.p: Louisville, Kentucky, sheriff and soldier. Kentucky native. Married to Sarah A. Price Megowan. Father of Warner Megowan, Edward W. Megowan, Franklin Megowan, and Sarah Megowan. United States Postmaster in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1845. Clerk in Warren County, Kentucky, in 1850. Owned three enslaved persons in Warren County in 1850. Served in the Falls City Guards as first lieutenant in Louisville, Kentucky, in 1858. Sheriff in Louisville in 1860. Owned five enslaved persons in Louisville in 1860. Sheriff in Louisville in 1861. Served in the 3rd Kentucky Volunteer Cavalry (U.S.A.) as a major from December 13, 1861, to August 31, 1862. Auctioneer in Louisville in 1865.
